Pre-Game Insights: England’s T20I captain, Jos Buttler, might miss some of the series due to injury concerns.
Pakistan’s team is injury-free and in good shape for the series.
The match is the first of a four-match series between England and Pakistan, with both teams aiming to prepare for the T20 World Cup 2024.
England and Pakistan have a strong head-to-head record in T20Is, with England having won 19 out of 29 matches.
The toss-winning captain is likely to opt for batting first, considering the venue trends and conditions.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The venue, Headingley, Leeds, has an average-pace bowling track and moderate batting conditions.
Clear skies and gentle winds are expected, providing ideal cricketing conditions.
The series victory against Ireland and a recent mixed form for England and Pakistan set the stage for an intriguing clash.
Others: Predicted XIs for both teams are provided, with Jos Buttler leading England and Mohammad Rizwan wicketkeeping for Pakistan.
The match is the first of the Pakistan tour of England 2024, with the series being crucial for both teams ahead of the T20 World Cup.
